MouseEvents.description: Fired when a pointing device button is pressed and released over an element.
MouseEvents.userAction: Press and release a mouse button.

MouseEvents.description: Fired when a pointing device button is double-clicked over an element.
MouseEvents.userAction: Press and release a mouse button twice quickly.

KeyboardEvents.description: Fired when a key that produces a character value is pressed down.
KeyboardEvents.userAction: Press a key that results in a character value (e.g., 'a', '1').

TouchEvents.description: Fired when one or more touch points are placed on the touch surface.
TouchEvents.userAction: Place one or more fingers on the touch surface.

TouchEvents.description: Fired when one or more touch points are moved along the touch surface.
TouchEvents.userAction: Move one or more fingers along the touch surface.

TouchEvents.description: Fired when one or more touch points are removed from the touch surface.
TouchEvents.userAction: Lift one or more fingers off the touch surface.

TouchEvents.description: Fired when the touch point has been disrupted in an implementation-specific manner.
TouchEvents.userAction: The touch is interrupted or canceled due to a system event.

DragAndDropEvents.description: Fired when the user starts dragging an element or text selection.
DragAndDropEvents.userAction: Start dragging an element with the mouse.

DragAndDropEvents.description: Fired when an element or text selection is being dragged.
Fired when a dragged item enters a valid drop target.
DragAndDropEvents.userAction: Drag an item over a valid drop target.

DragAndDropEvents.description: Fired when an element or text selection is being dragged over a valid drop target.
DragAndDropEvents.userAction: Keep dragging an item over a valid drop target.

DragAndDropEvents.description: Fired when a dragged item leaves a valid drop target.
DragAndDropEvents.userAction: Move the dragged item away from the drop target.

DragAndDropEvents.description: Fired when an element or text selection is dropped on a valid drop target.
DragAndDropEvents.userAction: Release the dragged item onto the drop target.

DragAndDropEvents.description: Fired when a drag operation is ended.
DragAndDropEvents.userAction: End the drag operation (either by dropping or cancelling).

FileEvents.description: Fired when the value of a file input element changes.
FileEvents.userAction: Select or change a file in the file input.

WheelEvents.description: Fired when the mouse wheel is used to scroll the page or an element.
WheelEvents.userAction: Use the mouse wheel to scroll up or down.

ScrollEvents.description: Fired when an element or the document view is being scrolled.
ScrollEvents.userAction: Scroll the content within an element or the page.
